results.title: Northern oasis
results.creator_credit: E.M. Jackson and Boort Progress Association
results.brief_description:
A silent film about life in the North-Western Victorian country town of Boort during the 1940s. Produced by and for the people of Boort and district.
The Loddon Weir is shown, as are: local livestock sales, dairy, poultry, pork and citrus farming, school children at the small local school and Australia Day celebrations with athletics, a fashion parade, tennis, lawn bowls and decorative boat river regatta. The film ends with the “Water - the life-blood of the North. The future progress and prosperity of this Northern-Oasis depend upon its assured supply.”

results.title: Australian vintage
results.creator_credit: Peter Thompson, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film explores the development of the wine industry in Australia with particular reference to Australia’s international status as a wine producing country. Features an appearance by winemaker and writer Len Evans.

results.title: Mining in Action
results.creator_credit: Harold Dews, Conzinc Riotinto of Australia and Cinesound Movietone
results.brief_description: Surveys the development of mining operations of Hammersley Iron and Bougainville copper, the lead/zinc operation of the company and the opening of the aluminium smelter at Bluff, New Zealand.

results.title: A Banking career
results.creator_credit: Harley H. Davidson, Frederick Daniel and Artransa Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the various functions of a bank; the daily routine of business, and the responsibility of various bank officers. The latter part of the film lists the various advantages of making banking a career, mentioning rates of pay, special bonuses, opportunities for advancement, medical and sick leave benefits, pensions on retirement and the social life among bank personnel.

results.title: [Melbourne newsreel: 1925]
results.brief_description: A newsreel of Melbourne in 1925 containing scenes of Empire Day celebrations at Princes Hill State School, Carlton; the opening of the Melbourne Track Season; a three-mile handicap race at Caulfield Racecourse by the Combined Harriers; and long-distance running. Re-released in 1947 by the National Film Archive.

results.title: Upstream downstream
results.creator_credit: Peter Dimond, Igor Auzins, South Australian Film Corporation and Milton Ingerson Film and Television Productions
results.brief_description: A family takes a holiday on a houseboat on the River Murray, showing the activities and sites to be enjoyed by all age groups in the riverland’s of South Australia.

results.title: Day of the wag
results.creator_credit: John Dick, Milton Ingerson, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The problem of truancy is the subject of this film. Various factors contributing to truancy are raised for discussion, not the least of which is the common adult practice of taking a sickie. Cast includes Sue Berny, Judy Dick, Joe DiSario, Doug Gautier and others.

results.title: Mining men
results.creator_credit: Lilias Castle, Norman Castle and Conzinc Riotinto of Australia
results.brief_description: Describes the opportunities available for young men in the mining industry. It outlines the work of the graduate geologist, the mining engineer, the metallurgist and others and gives a comprehensive picture of life and work in new and developing mining communities of Australia.

results.title: Wyperfeld
results.brief_description: Wyperfeld National Park in North-western Victoria: its birds, animals, wildflowers and trees. The Ranger travels through the sand dunes of the Mallee country, stopping at a bore to pump water. Birds gather to drink - galahs, crested pigeons, ringneck parrots, honeyeaters, ravens and white cockatoos. Kangaroos, emus and the bushy-tailed possum abound amongst stands of red gums and Murray pine, and wildflowers seen include the white ever-lasting and Austral beauties. Bird watchers visiting the park study the beautiful Mallee fowl. Camera, editing and script: David Corke. Music: George Dreyfus Assistance and location recording: Peter Bruce. Park Ranger: Alec Campbell.
